sources.title: The G.I. Bill of Rights (1945)
sources.description: The G.I. Bill of Rights is a 1945 animated short directed by Shamus Culhane. This cartoon was featured as part of the U.S. military's "Army-Navy Screen Magazine, No. 60", issued in September 1945. The Servicemen's Readjustment Act of 1944, commonly known as the G.I. Bill, was a law that provided a range of benefits for returning World War II veteran. Watch on RetroFlix:Â

metadata.Plot: An illustration of the benefits and requirements of the G.I. Bill for honorably discharged US military personnel.
